Legal_Issue: Existence of Internal Flight Alternative (IFA) in Mexico City
Evidence_Type: Ombudsman report, evidence of state-cartel collusion, persecution in Durango
Legal_Provision: Section 97 and Section 98 of IRPA regarding Convention refugee status
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution based on political opinion or membership in a particular social group
Application_Error: Speculative finding of IFA without sufficient evidence
Review_Outcome: Case remanded for re-determination by a different RPD panel
Evidence_Ignored: Evidence of widespread persecution and state-cartel links in Mexico
Legal_Standard: Substantial evidence required to support IFA finding
Application_Factor: Geographic and political conditions in Mexico
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Internal Flight Alternative doctrine under Canadian refugee law
Cause_of_Refusal: Alleged availability of safe haven in Mexico City despite country conditions
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of evidence supporting IFA, reliance on speculation
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to properly assess objective evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of RPD decision
Jurisdictional_Focus: Mexico, specifically Durango and Mexico City
Relevant_Law: Canadian immigration and refugee law, UN Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees
Omission_Type: Failure to consider credible country condition evidence
